revised_title: African and Asian Perspectives on the Origins of Modern Humans
tldr: This article discusses the cultural evidence and its chronological context to imply behavioral patterning and identify possible causes of change in the transition from Middle to Upper Palaeolithic technology. It examines the spread of modern humans and the disappearance of archaic hominid populations, focusing on African and Asian perspectives. The article highlights the importance of improved dating methods, firmly dated fossil hominids, and new regional localities for a better understanding of the origin and spread of the modern genepool.
